channel.title: Adding a window (or frame) to computer screen
channel.description: Is it possible? By this I mean can you add a window or frame to, say, whatever's on top of your desktop. So you could add a mouselistener.. or hehe a keylistener to it, maybe? I was poking around with GraphicsEnvironment.. or Configuration? earlier but I didn't get anywhere.

item.title: Adding a window (or frame) to computer screen
item.dc:creator: @RegeX RegeX
item.description:
@RegeX wrote:

Wouldn’t work without nativehax, AWT is much seperate to native gui shite

Read full topic
item.source: Adding a window (or frame) to computer screen

item.title: Adding a window (or frame) to computer screen
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

I don’t think so, no. But I’ve never tried, so Im not 100% sure (99.99% sure)
Graphics Environment is for just that - Graphics BUT you can easily get the location of the mouse on screen if thats what you wanted to do =)

MouseInfo.getPointerInfo().getLocation();

Read full topic
item.source: Adding a window (or frame) to computer screen
